intro: Aeschynomene pluriarticulata, commonly known as the many-jointed goatherb, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with a sprawling or ascending habit. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in racemes, and are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Aeschynomene pluriarticulata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its use in traditional medicine and as a forage plant.
